questions.text: A 12-year-old boy without any known chronic illness presented with a 5-day history of sore throat, inability to talk, and difficult and painful swallowing of both liquid and food. His condition was associated with inability to open his mouth fully, drooling, a muffled “hot potato” voice, and sleep impairment. These symptoms were preceded by a mild sore throat and nasal discharge. He lost several kilograms during these days.On physical examination, the patient appeared pale, dehydrated, anxious, and sick.Oral examination revealed an abundance of secretion, which was removed by suction, bilateral enlarged tonsils obstructing 95% of the oral cavity, an edematous uvula with slight deviation to the left, and a congested and edematous soft palate (Fig).

options.label: B
options.text: The pus lies in the space between the superior constrictor muscle and the carotid sheath.

questions.text: All of the following statements regarding “Benign tumours of the paranasal sinuses” are true except:

options.label: A
options.text: Ivory osteoma of the frontal sinus is the commonest type.

options.label: B
options.text: The commonest presentation is headache due to pressure erosion of the anterior cranial fossa.

options.label: C
options.text: Mucocoele and ocular displacement are complications of frontal sinus osteoma.

options.label: D
options.text: Hyperostosis frontalis interna is a cause of headache in elderly females.

questions.correct_answer: B. The commonest presentation is headache due to pressure erosion of the anterior cranial fossa.

questions.text: A patient presents with a conductive hearing loss and negative Rinne tuning fork test (BC > AC). They also report episodic vertigo, low-pitched tinnitus, and ear fullness. What is the best management option for their hearing loss?

questions.text: Choose the most appropriate statement regarding “Objective Audiometry”

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: The postauricular myogenic responses give a very accurate measure of hearing thresholds in young children.

questions.correct_answer: A. A large summating potential on electrocochleography is a reflection of hair cell damage.

The patient's history revealed history of sexual activity with several women, without use of condoms. Physical examination showed slightly hard bilateral facial masses with no signs of inflammation. The examination of the mouth (including the teeth) was normal. No organomegaly, enlargement of the lymph nodes or other abnormal finding was apparent in the rest of the examination. questions.correct_answer: B. Typhoid ulcers are placed transversely to the long axis of the gut

questions.text: A patient with mechanical mitral valve, who was on anticoagulant an elective endoscopy and ERCP and sphincterotomy was planned for cholangitis. Which of the following is incorrect statement regarding his anti coagulation regime?

A 21-year-old man with H/O poorly controlled hypertension presented with episodic diaphoresis and headaches. The patient's laboratory workup showed normal plasma aldosterone and normal renin. His free plasma metanephrine level was elevated so was his 24-hour urine catecholamine excretion rate but normal dopamine and epinephrine His MIBG scintigraphy (Figure 1) and computed tomographic scan of the abdomen and pelvis (Figure 2) are given below. Which of the following statements are correct?

options.label: A
options.text: These findings are consistent with Neuroblastoma.

options.label: C
options.text: Preoperative Biopsy should always be done.

options.label: D
options.text: Malignant potential in such tumours are 50%.

questions.correct_answer: D. Malignant potential in such tumours are 50%.

What is the most probable diagnosis

questions.text: In a case of impalpable testis during laparoscopy the testicular artery was found entering into the internal ring. What should be next step in surgery?

options.label: A
options.text: Explore inguinal canal from outside and do orchidopexy

options.label: D
options.text: Stop the procedure and give a course of GnRH

questions.correct_answer: A. Explore inguinal canal from outside and do orchidopexy

questions.text: A 21-year-old man presents with eye redness, itching, and watering; nasal congestion and rhinorrhea. He reports that these symptoms have been occurring every year in the late spring since he was 18 years old. The patient‘s medical history is significant for endoscopic resection of a right maxillary sinus polyp at the age of 17. His father and younger sister have bronchial asthma. On physical examination, there is conjunctival injection and clear nasal discharge bilaterally. His lymph nodes are not enlarged and his sinuses do not cause pain upon palpation. Heart and lung sounds are normal. Which of the is following is most likely to be a part of his condition's pathogenesis?

options.label: A
options.text: Production of specific lgM antibodies by B lymphocytes

options.label: B
options.text: Secretion of granzymes and perforin by cytotoxic T lymphocytes

options.label: C
options.text: Excessive release of histamine by the mast cells

questions.correct_answer: C. Excessive release of histamine by the mast cells

questions.text: A previously healthy 29-year-old man comes to the clinic due to fever and rash. Four days ago, he developed a high fever and malaise followed by the appearance of multiple discrete macules on his face, trunk, and extremities as shown in the image. The lesions are pruritic and evolved into pustules then vesicles. The patient has continued to develop new vesicles as other lesions crust over and heal. The remainder of the examination is unremarkable. What is the infectivity period of the infection?

options.label: A
options.text: 4 days before and 5 days after appearance of the rash

options.label: B
options.text: 2 days before and 5 days after appearance of the rash

options.label: C
options.text: 7 days after appearance of the rash

options.label: D
options.text: 1 day before and 15 days after appearance of the rash

questions.correct_answer: B. 2 days before and 5 days after appearance of the rash

questions.text: Reassortment of the genetic materials occurred during coinfection with human influenza virus and swine influenza virus, leading to the development of some progeny that contain genetic materials from both viruses. Which of the followingviruses can undergo a similar process?

A 26-year-old man develops dysuria and purulent urethral discharge following unprotected sex with a new partner. Nucleic acid amplification testing is positive for Neisseria gonorrhoeae infection. The patient develops antibody against the bacterial pill that enhance attachment to host cells. His symptoms resolve with adequate treatment. His partner does not receive treatment. Several weeks later, the patient develops N gonorrhea reinfection after repeat exposure to the same partner. Which of the following is the most likely reason for the lack of long-lasting immunity against the bacteria despite antibody formation in this patient?

A 54-year-old Sudanese immigrant is evaluated for several months of intermittent dysuria and gross hematuria. The patient notes that he passes blood at the end of urination but has no associated pain. Cystoscopy reveals erythematous areas in the bladder mucosa. Multiple biopsies are taken from the affected sites; histopathological findings are shown in the image. Which of the following most likely predisposed this patient to his current condition?

A 26-year-old man is being evaluated for recurrent boils and skin abscesses. Anterior nares swab culture is performed to determine colonization by the culprit bacteria, which yields gram-positive cocci in clusters. The bacteria are able to grow in a media containing oxacillin. PCR testing reveals the pathogen has acquired the mecA gene. These bacteria are most likely to be resistant to which of the following antibiotics?

A 18-year-old previously healthy adolescent from a rural village developed non-productive cough, dyspnea, and wheezing. The patient has no history of allergies and has had no recent upper respiratory illness. The symptoms spontaneously resolved after several days, but soon after, she began having abdominal discomfort, anorexia, nausea and diarrhoea. Stool microscopy results are shown in the following image. What is the infective stage of the pathogen?

An 86-year-old woman is hospitalized for a urinary tract infection due to Escherichia coli and is being is treated with ceftriaxone. She has a history of advanced dementia, coronary artery disease, and congestive heart failure. On the fifth day of hospitalization, she seems agitated. The nurse also reports that the patient had 3 episodes of diarrhea the previous night. If the pathogen is an anaerobe associated with Antibiotic associated enterocolitis, what may be the ideal selective medium?

A 59-year-old woman is brought to the emergency department with fever, skin flushing, and an altered level of Consciousness. Her blood pressure is 50/20 mmHg, and her heart rate is 120/min despite receiving lV fluids. Blood cultures are positive for E. coli. Choose the correct bacterial structure most directly responsible for this patient's current condition?

options.label: C

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: C. Yersinia pestis is category A bioterrorism agent

questions.text: The study included 1,000 who took the new drug for 5 years and 1,000 were given the standard therapy. At the end of the trial, 6% of the men in the standard therapy group experienced a stroke, compared to only 2% in the group taking the new drug. Which of the following is true :

options.label: A
options.text: 25 men had to receive the new drug for 5 years in order for one man to benefit (i.e. one less stroke to occur)

options.label: B
options.text: 20 men had to receive the new drug for 5 years in order for one man to benefit (i.e. one less stroke to occur)

questions.correct_answer: A. 25 men had to receive the new drug for 5 years in order for one man to benefit (i.e. one less stroke to occur)

You are evaluating a journal article describing a test for the diagnosis of congestive heart failure (CHF). In the study described, 250 consecutive patients were given the test. Of the 250 subjects, 100 tested positive tor CHF and 150 tested negative. All 250 subjects were then evaluated by expert cardiologists who were blinded to the results at the experimental test. These cardiologists determined that out of persons who tested positive, 90 actually had CHF. Further, the cardiologists found that of the 150 who tested negative, 20 truly had CHF. What is the positive predictive value (PPV) of this test for the diagnosis of CHF?

questions.text: Which of the following is not a parameter in Downe’s scoring?
Preductal spO2 is measured at
An infant of DM mother had an episode of seizure. Apart from doing blood glucose, which other tests should be done?
Peripheral pulmonary stenosis is not seen in
questions.explanation:
References:

  • ↳ • A familial tendency has been recognized in some patients with peripheral pulmonic stenosis.
  • ↳ • A high incidence is found in infants with congenital rubella syndrome.
  • ↳ • The combination of supravalvular aortic stenosis with pulmonary arterial branch stenosis, idiopathic hypercalcemia of infancy, elfin facies, and mental retardation is known as Williams syndrome, a condition associated with deletion of the elastin gene in region 7q11.23 on chromosome 7.
  • ↳ • Peripheral pulmonary stenosis is also associated with the Alagille syndrome, which may be associated with a mutation in the Jagged1 gene.

A previously healthy 5-year-old boy has a 1-day history of low-grade fever, colicky abdominal pain, and a rash. He is well appearing and alert. His vital signs, other than temperature of 38°C (100.5°F), are completely normal. A diffuse, erythematous, maculopapular, and petechial rash is present on his buttocks and lower extremities, as shown in the photograph. He has no localized abdominal tenderness or rebound; bowel sounds are active. Laboratory data demonstrate Urinalysis: 30 red blood cells (RBCs) per high-powered field, 2+ protein Stool: Guaiac positive Platelet count: 135,000/μL

options.label: A

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: 4 or more episodes in a single year or 6 or more, ever with radiological clearing in between

questions.correct_answer: A. 2 or more episodes in a single year or 3 or more, ever with radiological clearing in between

questions.text: A 28 years old G2P1L1 with 37 weeks of gestation with previous LSCS done in view of fetal distress has gone in active labor with cephalic presentation. On PV examination, cervix is 7 cm dilated, 80% effaced, station is -3, diagonal conjugate is 10.5 cm. The expected fetal weight is 3 kg. She has a history of undergoing myomectomy for FIGO type 7 which was done 2 years back. What is your further line of management?

options.label: A
options.text: Do emergency LSCS in view of myomectomy in past

options.label: C
options.text: Do emergency LSCS in view of contracted pelvis.

options.label: D
options.text: Conduct operative vaginal delivery by vacuum application

questions.correct_answer: C. Do emergency LSCS in view of contracted pelvis.

questions.text: A 23-year-old boy presents with pain in the right iliac fossa associated with vomiting and fever. He had a past history of incision and drainage of a perianal abscess. questions.text: A 4 year child underwent an allogenic hematopoietic stem cell transplant with a 4/6 HLA match. Three weeks after the transplant the child has itchy scales on the skin and diarrhoea. Blood examination shows an elevated bilirubin. Which of the following is not true about the disease?

questions.text: A 75-year-old man presents with development of abdominal obesity, proximal myopathy, and skin hyperpigmentation. His laboratory evaluation shows a hypokalemic metabolic alkalosis. Which of the following statements regarding this syndrome is true?

options.label: B
options.text: Circulating corticotropin-releasing hormone is likely to be elevated.

options.label: C
options.text: Pituitary magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) will visualize all ACTH-secreting tumors.

questions.correct_answer: D. Serum potassium level <3.3 mmol/L is suggestive of ectopic ACTH production.

questions.text: A 45-year-old man reports to his primary care physician that his wife has noted coarsening of his facial features over several years. questions.text: A 22-year-old woman who is otherwise healthy undergoes an uneventful vaginal delivery of a full term infant. One day postpartum, she complains of visual changes and severe headache. Her blood pressure is 68/28 mmHg, regular heart rate is 148 bpm, her oxygen saturation is 95% on fraction of inspired oxygen (FiO2) of 0.40. Physical exam is unremarkable.
